document_title: MetaMiner: A Scalable Peptidogenomics Approach for Discovery of Ribosomal Peptide Natural Products with Blind Modifications from Microbial Communities
summary_full: This paper introduces MetaMiner, a novel software tool designed to overcome limitations in discovering Ribosomally synthesized and Post-translationally modified Peptides (RiPPs) from large-scale genomic and metagenomic datasets. Existing methods struggle with unknown post-translational modifications and are not scalable. MetaMiner integrates genome mining with computational mass spectrometry, enabling the search of millions of spectra against numerous genomic datasets. The tool successfully identified 31 known and 7 unknown RiPPs from diverse microbial communities, including the human microbiome, lichen microbiome, and microorganisms from the International Space Station. This approach significantly advances the discovery of natural products with potential pharmaceutical applications.
key_findings: Developed MetaMiner, a scalable software tool for discovering RiPPs from large-scale genomic and metagenomic data.
MetaMiner can identify RiPPs with unknown post-translational modifications, overcoming a major limitation of previous methods.
Successfully discovered 31 known and 7 novel RiPPs from diverse microbial communities, including human, lichen, and space station microbiomes.
The tool integrates genome mining with computational mass spectrometry, enabling efficient analysis of millions of spectra.
MetaMiner supports the discovery of various RiPP classes beyond lanthipeptides, including lassopeptides, LAPs, and cyanobactins.
One of the newly discovered RiPPs, wewakazole, was isolated and its structure confirmed through orthogonal methods.
future_research_fields: Expanding MetaMiner's capabilities to include a wider range of natural product classes.
Applying MetaMiner to even larger and more diverse metagenomic datasets to uncover more novel RiPPs.
Investigating the biological activities and potential pharmaceutical applications of the newly discovered RiPPs.
Further refining the computational algorithms for even faster and more accurate RiPP identification.
Integrating MetaMiner with other omics data (e.g., transcriptomics, metabolomics) for a more comprehensive understanding of RiPP biosynthesis and function.

conclusions: MetaMiner represents a significant advancement in the discovery of ribosomally synthesized and post-translationally modified peptides (RiPPs) by enabling scalable, automated analysis of large-scale genomic and mass spectrometry data. Its ability to identify RiPPs with unknown modifications from diverse microbial communities, including those from extreme environments like the International Space Station, opens new avenues for natural product discovery. The successful identification and validation of novel RiPPs demonstrate the tool's potential to accelerate the search for new bioactive compounds.
impact_statement: MetaMiner significantly enhances the discovery of novel bioactive natural products from microbial communities by providing a scalable computational framework for identifying complex peptides with unknown modifications.
